values:
"Summer time and the wind is blowing outside in lower Pennsylvania. 
And I don't know what I'm doing in this city, 
The sun is always in my eyes, 
It crashes through the windows, And I'm sleeping on the couch"

THE PAST FEW DAYS HAVE BEEN BEAUTIFUL!  

"I've never been so ALIVE!"

I now find myself working at least 10 hours a day and working hard to get my deadlines finished before they are due, but that mission is almost next to impossible.  It is Saturday and I am definitely at work.  But you know what, I luv it.  The constant challenge and the independence.  

FREEDOM!

When I finally finish work or even before it starts each morning, I do one of my most beloved passions in the world...DRIVING!  Now that the sun is out and shining brightly with warm breezes, "GOSH!" I luv it.  Especially since I have a sunroof in my car.  I play my music and just sit back enjoying this simple pleasure, though it may become costly with the price of gas going up in the US.  Oh well enjoy it while it last.  

So this leads me to tell all of you who own a car or know someone who does. Go driving on a sunny day.  Where?  Who cares, just go and listen to ur favorite tunes.  SMILE!  FORGET! 

WE ALL DESERVE HAPPINESS!

MAN!!! These past two weeks have been flying by.  Oh and the weather has been great for last week.  Tanning and sunshine is all I am thinking about.  Plus girls!  Cannot forget them :)

Not much to say on my daily life though, just work and more work.  I met with a Congressman this past weekend on domestic relations.  Nothing grand to mention because it was simply a promotional calling for him.  

My new job has been fun.  I work a lot, but I enjoy it.  Almost every minute of every day.  

No philosophical thoughts at the moment.  So if u were hoping for something interesting, I am sorry :(  

Enjoy the weather(if u have the same weather that I am enjoying)

My Easter went quite well.  Starting Friday evening, I left with my cousins, whom are the same age as me, to our mountain houses.  With us we took 4 dirt bikes and a 4-wheeler.  Saturday brought us an unexpected surprise.  Almost 2 inches of snow fell on our side of the mountain and a thick fog(one of those that u see in scary movies) covered the land.  Now a sensible person would say that this is too dangerous to ride and call it quits.  HA HA HA!!!!  NOT ME, MISTER SUPERMAN! 
 On a 4-wheeler, riding at top speeds I sank my ride in some of the deepest mud I have ever seen.   WOOHOO!!! I was freezing, but I was luving life.  The fog with the snow covered trees gave me a feeling that I had crossed into some magical realm where Dwarves worked under the mountain and elves lived in the trees.  Let us not forget the unicorns and dragons that could cross ur path any second.  As I was day dreaming another tsunami of mud water came crashing down on me as I ran thru another pool.  
 Towards the end of the day, after drinking some beer (yeah real hick right) and warming myself back up, my cousins and decided to go to the haunted coal mine. Yeah really, there is a coal mine in this one mountain that has a lake next to it.  Now to create the effect for u, some 60 to 100 or so years ago, this region of Pennsylvania was a huge coal mining area.  This one mine in particular was filled with hussle and bussle of miners who worked for a local mining company.  Then with no warning, the mining stopped and the miners just disappeared.  No one knows where they went or how they just disappeared.  To this day, one can travel to the mine, which is quite a distance from civilization and find all the equipment and the mine still sitting there.  STRANGE HUH?!!
 Ok, to finish my Easter weekend, I went back home near Philly on Sunday morning and had dinner with my mother's side of the family.  That was all.

Hello there Everyone!!! 
 I bet many of you thought that I had died or something close to that.  Well I have not died yet, but I will someday.  As for right now I am career transitioning again.  The last time many of us corresponded, I was looking for a career.  Right now that is not the situation.  I am leaving my job as a Software/Systems/Test Engineer and Project Manager in Atlantic City and moving back home.  One does not know how much family and friends are worth, till they are gone.  So I am taking a HUGE pay cut and going to work for a small civil engineering company in West Chester, PA, USA.  
 
 Well enough about me, I have been trying to catch up on everyone's journal entries for the past month or so, but I cannot absorb all the information.  Therefore, if you would be so kind as to leave a little info about ur current situation.  I miss hearing from everyone.  
 
 Lastly I would like to apologize to everyone who I left behind when I started working.  I still am intrigued by everyone's life and wish that I could have kept up with all of you. 
 
 Ok now I am going to finish up my last two days of work and smile about life.  I just wish this rain would stop.  This past winter must have set records across all of North America for rain fall/mixed with some snow.  The whole continent deserves a beautiful spring and summer.

Long time, no see!!!

I've been doing a lot of traveling lately and between that, my part time job at GAP.  Well here's the update.  As few of you know, I had a job interview in Cali for the sales position.  Things looked good from the start and I found myself thinking, "What would it be like living in Cali?"  Well I might just find out.  Yesterday, I received a phone call and it was the company informing me that I got the job.  It starts at only $50K though.   So the only two bummers of this situation is that it has low pay and is in Cali.  Other than that, everything fits. 

But there is a chance that I might find myself in New Hampshire, instead of Cali.  Tomorrow, I will be flown up there for an interview with a company called Rehrig.  They are a packaging company and they wish to hire me for sales.  I am highly motivated for this position and everything fits, but I yet to know about their benefits package.  That is a key thing for me, since I have severe asthma. 

Well drop a line on with ur thoughts or criticisms.  I am def. open to all suggestions.

Today I had an interview with this financial firm called Telematics.  I believe that it went well, but only time will tell. 

"I won't worry my life away!"

Well this Thursday I will be flown out to Cali for an interview with a company named Firth Rixson.  They are the largest supplier of alloy forgings to the US government.  They wish to place me in sales, because of all my DOD contacts(Depart. of Defense). I am not certain if I want to move out to Cali, but they are paying for everything while I'm out there.  They are even given me a car for the 3 days that I am there.  Woohoo!!!

"You can turn off the sun, but I'm still going to shine"

Oh...I cannot wait to start my life and be free finally.  This life with my parents is not bad, but I feel so confined and limited.  Every morning I wakeup with this pressure that I have to make my parents happy.  AAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!!!!!  I hate this.  Where is that mountain.  Maybe it is in Cali? or Boston? or DC? 

Sorry about the pics from my graduation.  I will have them out to u soon.  Promise!

OMG, a modeling agency called me last week and they want me to start a portfolio with them.  The agency is called barbizon or something like that. I am still in shock, because I never called them nor provided them with any information.  In truth, I was actually moving in a different direction.  Well we shall see what aspires from this.

Last week I went to an interview down in DC and it was not cool.  I arrived to the area a hour early, but for some reason the road, which the company was located near, could not be found.  First, I go searching and get lost.  Second, a car decided to switch lanes in front of traffic coming the opposite direction. This created an huge accident, which I did not care about at all, because I was extremely frustrated that for the past 45 minutes I had been searching for this stupid road.  So I next decide to wave down a cop and have myself pulled over.  She had no idea where this road was and when we go to look it up, all we find was NOTHING!  I decided to turn around and 20 minutes in the opposite direction I come across the darn road.  As you can probably guess, it did not end there.  Of course I go the wrong direction and find myself talking to people at a local community office.  Thankfully they were bored out of their minds with their jobs, so they were more than willing to help me search for the place.  So Chris finally shows up to the interview a whole hour late.  The interviewer did not care, however, because it turned out that his job was boring and the job that I was being interviewed for was boring as well.  Now one may think that this would end this horrible ordeal, but this was not so AGAIN.  On my way home, I decided to take a nap at a rest stop, because I had worked till 2 that morning and only got a small nap in before heading to DC, which is 3 hours away.  Well I am awakened by a bright flash light and a state trooper behind the light.  So I took a quick look around and find the entire lot and rest stop empty, except me of course.  It turns out that a serious gas leek was occurring and the place was evacuated a hour before.  But no one decided to take a quick look at the only car in the lot.  Nice of them to let me start my car up that uses a spark to begin the whole thermodynamic process.  Woohoo...BOOM! 

Thank goodness that I have all of you lj peeps to release my thoughts to. I hope everyones' summer is starting off well.  I want to see pictures people.  Go get tan or naked or whatever makes you smile:)

I am off to Washingto DC tomorrow for a job interview.  Sorry that I have been so slow with the replies and updates, but I've been working till 1-2 in the mornings and I find myself doing other crap like fixing wells and digging really big holes during the mornings. 

Oh, so if any one of you will be in DC tomorrow, just give me a ring.  845-323-6380.  I'll be more than happy to meet you somewhere after lunch tomorrow.  Probably in the early evening, just in case I have to make a trip around the plant. 

Ok its back to paying bills and building a cement/brick frame for our pump casing.  Leave one and I'll get back whenever possible.

Off to my mountain house this weekend, but first I have to work till 1am at GAP.  Oh, for all those who keep asking, the GAP is not open till 1am.  The reason I work till then is due to the fact that we sell so many clothes during the day, we are forced to restock almost everyday.  I hope that answer some of your questions. 

Quick question: When comparing the Simpson sisters, what are you opinions on them. I do not feel that there really is a comparison between the two.  Jessica is pop with a soft touch and Ashlee is alternative/pop with a deeper meaning, but what is up with the black hair on Ashlee?  Seriously, I thought she looked HOT with the blonde.  Her excuse was that she wanted to look different than her sister, which makes sense to me....but black?  Well post your thoughts.  I will respond them them when I return from my family reunion. 

Oh, I will be posting my pictures shortly from my graduation.  Yes, graduation was like 3 weeks ago, but my father's camera has been giving us problems.  So do not worry there, the pix will be shown.

I'm at my cousins' house in Bridgeport, PA.  It is right outside Philly. 

I came over here last night, because I could not stand staying at home.  I had to get out of the house.  As soon as I arrived, we went out and bought some 40's and then had a few cigars.  --I LUV CIGARS, THOUGH THEY ARE CONSIDERED EXTREMELY HAZARDOUS TO MY HEALTH--  After finishing off the 40's, my cousin, John's girlfriend called us an told us about a party at her friend's house.  So we decided to join in the fun since there was free beer. 

Arriving to the house, it appeared as if no one was there.  So the first image coming to my mind was of about 8 people drinking inside and watching TV.  Complete losers, who have never known the opposite sex except for maybe the band bus.   I was starting to worry, but as soon as I opened the door, a different image became clear to me.  This girl named Megan was doing a kegg stand with about 10 people standing around her counting.  Booze everywhere and there was music.  I had to ask myself, why was it so dark outside and little noise to announce the party.  It turns out that Megan, who is partial owner of the house, is in police training and cannot afford to be involved in any civil misdemeanors.  This made me feel a little more comfortable about the situation. 

Well I started drinking immediately and one must remember that I had already drank a 40 and a half back at my cousin's house.  Oh another point that I must mention.  This entire drinking expedition begun, because I did not have a graduation party.  So my cousins wished to give me a belated one.  I did not argue with this fact.  Back to the story.  So I drank and drank and the girls at this place, whom I have never met, were really trying to take me upstairs.  I was like WO!  At no point did I wish to become involve with any of these females, since I knew nothing about them and they were a little...um...how should I put this...NOT MY TYPE. 

This Megan girl kept at it though, the entire night.  Until I decided to get out of there.  Then she was like, let me tell u 3 things.  (1) I really like u cuz ur a West Pointer (2) I think ur really, really cute (3) repeats number 2.  She was really drunk and I was not interested.  But the buzz that I got from the entire night, definitely made it worth the while. 

Then I found myself sleeping back at my cuz's--ALONE--and dreaming a wonderful dream.  I was an engineer for the state department and I was wearing a suit.  oohh...a suit.  Ok, so it was not a perfect night, but it was good to spend some time with my cuzs.

I luv this song~100 years by Five for Fighting

Do you remember those years, when u were:

"I'm 15 for a moment
Caught in between 10 and 20
And I'm just dreaming
Counting the ways to where you are"

Those years seemed so easy, now that I am looking back.  But when we lived during those years, everything was important.  Who you ate with, who to talk to, what to wear (still important today), and how you got to school. Now we have more intense and life changing decisions.

"I'm 22 for a moment
She feels better than ever
And we're on fire
Making our way back from Mars
15 there's still time for you
Time to buy and time to lose
15, there's never a wish better than this
When you only got 100 years to live"

Yes! I feel like there is so much to do and time to enjoy it, but then I really look at "TIME".  In 3-5 years, I plan on starting and finishing either law school or my MBA.  Then hopefully have met the girl of my dreams and marring her.  By 28-30 I want to have a kid maybe and "WOW" that is a whole new ball game.  Who is to say what life will be like once the minnie mes' or hers' start running around. 

" I'm 33 for a moment
Still the man, but you see I'm a they
A kid on the way
A family on my mind "

That portion of the song says it all.  Then there is the next step. 

"I'm 45 for a moment
The sea is high
And I'm heading into a crisis
Chasing the years of my life
15 there's still time for you
Time to buy, Time to lose yourself
Within a morning star
15 I'm all right with you
15, there's never a wish better than this
When you only got 100 years to live"

Ok, well I am going to leave this portion of my life to time and see where it takes me.  I do not want to think this far ahead, unless I am completing my financial plans through my brokerage accountant.

--FOR SOME REASON MY ADVANCE OPTIONS ARE NOT WORKING, SO I AM FORCED TO USE THE BASIC FORMAT FOR THIS ENTRY...OH WELL--

"Don't waste your time on me you're already 
The voice inside my head (I miss you miss you)
Don't waste your time on me you're already 
The voice inside my head (I miss you miss you)"

  Has anyone noticed how fewer comments have been posted since classes have ended for us?  Sometimes it almost comes across as the though the world has decided to jump onboard with a cosmonaut and taken off, but leaving some of us behind in the process.  
  Yes, I understand that life has picked up since most of us need jobs and are planning the "The Greatest of All Summers!"  So I find myself asking this question, "Should I go back should I go back should I
I feel alone and tired," but does that really answer anything or help my situation at all?  
  Thinking on this subject, I find what is best for all of us now is an adventure!  Yes, something to take us from this boring reality called our present life and let us move towards something new, even if it is temporary.  Oh my, remember and record.  Then when ur adventure comes to either an end or falls onto an even plain, just respond and tell us.  We all shall be here at some point to imagine it as if we were there.  
  Oh, if u can't think of one, well try my mind out for some advise.  I think I can help u with that area.  If not there are plenty of us here to help you.  "Use me LJ come on and use me"

"Cause ever since I tried
Trying not to find
Every little meaning in my life
It's been fine
I've been cool
With my new golden rule"

Sorry everyone for the past few days of uncertainty on where I have been or what has my life been leaning towards.  I have been sick with the ever common allergy attack, but this has affected my asthma and so I have found myself in the doctors.  Nothing serious, just much rest is needed inorder to regain my strength.   

So my life...

     I am so anxious to start ME!  I understand that I should be patient, but I just came from an environment that commanded initiative and there was never room for delay.  Yet I fin myself waiting and hoping for a prayer.

"Is there a God?
Why is he waiting?
Don't you think of it odd
When he knows my address?
And look at the stars
Don't they remind you of just how feeble we are?
Well it used to, I guess"

So there is this agency called the United States Department of the State.  --YES IT SOUNDS KORNEY, BUT THEY HAVE THE JOBS SO I'M NOT SAYING ANYTHING--  I have been applying for a job with them for months now and no word has ever been heard from them, until yesterday.  I must have been on the phone with one of the directors for an hour.  They want me to create a new resume and send it to them by Monday!  WOOHOO!  Sorry for the sudden outburst and change in character, but I find myself somewhat overwhelmed with joy.  Back on subject...after I send them my new resume, they wish to possibly setup an interview with them.  I would be interviewing for a Civil engineering position, which I am more than interested in.  Unfortunately there is a slight catch and that is I must take TDY with the agency.  TDY is Temporary Duty Assignment.  This means that I will have to travel to other countries for durations of 6 months to a year, sometimes less and sometimes more. 

Well I want to live many adventures and this job may provide for me.  I may end up in Canada or England for all I know.  Well let me end this entry before it gets too lengthy.

Today I found myself going through the same routine as before.  Calling employers and requesting an update on my status as a potential employee for their firms.  As usually I receive the same reply, "I'm sorry, but we are still reviewing applicants for the position and will get back with u at a later date."

My mountain is sliding away and I feel as if there is nothing I can do about it.  My life as been structured so that I would be the "golden" child of the family, yet I feel that my life has gone no where.  Four years at West Point and all I can do is work with my father as a janitor. 

These past few mornings, I have woken up to gray skies and dark clouds.  I cannot see the blue skies with the high mountains.  Where is my path? 

...I stop but no sound to be heard.  No music or rhythm to follow and guide my heart beat.  I want to scream and run, but where.  I feel depressed and have no one to cheer me up.  My parents try hard, but little helps.  All my friends are gone and I am the lone soldier not fit for duty.  My country can no longer use me.  My dream ripped away like dust in the wind.  No more glory or honor.  I once again stop and look around.  I am in a gray field with a hazing mist.  I call out to my comrades, but to my sudden realization.  No one is calling back.  They have marched forward to the drum beat and I have fallen behind, wounded on the battlefield.  How can I look my commander in the eyes?  My country, my friends, the citizens whom I have sworn to protect; I turn my head in shame.  I can never look at them the same.  I have failed them all. 
   Maybe life wanted this path for me.  To let me live a little, then falter so that I may remain humble.  But why me, for I have not done anything wrong.  All I asked for is to give my life to my country and serve it with the utmost honor and discipline.  I want to lead those gallant armies onto the field.  I wanted to be the savior of so many innocent people, when they needed hope.  Yet, I am now that innocent person who has little hope.  I asked for freedom and I believe they have given it to me.  Is this what freedom is really like.  Lonely!
   I am tired and feel as if I should give up.  My feet are tired of marching and my eyes are shot with blood from countless nights on watch.  Too many times have I heard the bombs overhead and men crying out to me for help.  I guess it is time for me to lay down and let myself just drift. Back, back to another place.  Somewhere simple and without fear and anxiety.  Like my father's dream, where no one suffers and life is simple.  Everyone just puts in hard labor and reaps the un-complex rewards.  Maybe I should find myself a bar and just forget about my past.  Where I could have been had I not been wounded.  Stop  trying to run and just walk.  Stop trying to reach the tallest mountain and just guide around it.  Stop caring for others and just worry about myself...

I need to find my blue skies with the tall mountains again.  Where are my waterfalls at, with lush green vegetation?  I want to hear the birds chirping and see the clouds form funny images again.  Let me see what tomorrow has for me.  It is time for me to go to bed now.

Tomorrow I take down my computer and this creates an unfortunate problem, for I will not be able to update or respond for some unknown period of time.  Hopefully, it shall only take a few days before I am up and running againg, but I do not wish to create a false hope.  So let us all believe that I will be away for a long duration and therefore, only surprise will be waiting if I update sooner than later.

Before I go, I took some pictures yesterday and today of my roomies and of the Academy.  I will leave u all with some shared memories.  Please feel free to continue to respond to my journal and I promise that I will reply in kind, whenever that time may be. 

My countries Colors!  (for u Brits...Colours!)

Discipline is key!

Been there done that...the flag thingy

Note: the "TIGHT" white pants chics!

All those men for all u women...

Ok, I have no idea what those stripes mean...but they are important.

"Where is my company?"--The lone cadet

"Follow Me!"--George Washington

 

My grandparents...I luv them very much!

This is my class crest!  Go 2004!

Army Pride!

Hooah...Can't leave without the American flag with the Army flag!

Yes, this is the proper word for me right now. JERK!

"I'm not a perfect person
as many things I wish I didn't do
but I continue learning
I never meant to do those things to you
and so I have to say before I go
that I just want you to know

I've found a reason for me
to change who I used to be
a reason to start over new
and the reason is you"

I have a problem world.  I find it difficult for me to be attracted to someone who is over weight.  I do not wish to be like this, but it is how I am.  Let me tell u my story. 

As many of u know I was adopted when I was 8, but what many of u do not know is my life before my adoption.  There are many stories to tell, but there is one in particular that pertains to my current flaw.  At the age of 4, I moved in with a family where only the mother and daughter lived, with two boys.  One of the boys was named Angel who was 18 years old.  Angel was mentally retarded.  The other boy I do not remember his name, but he was younger than me and was African American.  I came into this family with my younger cousin of about a month difference, who I believed to be my brother.  Because I was the oldest, I took on the leadership role and grew up immediately.  I am not ashamed for this factor, because I believe that this is one reason why I am able to attend the United States Military Academy.  But this is not my problem, my problem has to do with my dislike towards overweigth individuals. 

Now both the mother and daughter were extremely overweight and they had a great dislike towards Angel and my foster brother(the african american).  I did not fully understand their discontent towards them at 4, but I hated it all the same.  This is just the icing on the cake however.  As time went on, we kids would make mistakes.  But instead of punishing us accordingly, both the mother and daughter would hit us.  Now I could not stand this and I luved my brothers.  So after some time, I would start lying for my brothers and take the beatings.  Yet this continuing enslavement by these two women, only developed and increased my dislike towards those who are overweight.  I HATE THEM FOR THIS! 

This is not an excuse for my ignorance, because this illness of mine hurts others.  There is a slight positive to this entire situation and that is my awareness.  Over the years, I have been working hard to curve this judgment.  I have learned that once I get to know someone, I can look past most of the physical features.  However, this does not appear to carry over into my luv life.  I cannot find it in my heart yet, to care for someone who is not to my specifications. 

So here is a glimpse into my non-superman qualities.  This might also give many of u an understanding of why I find working out such a luv in my life.  I am sorry to all of you who believed in me and have been disappointed by my ignorance.

Today I finished my last Final...9 days till graduation. 

I was listening to GooGoo Dolls~All Eyes on Me It got me to thinking of my time away from this place after graduation.  For the past four years, I have complained and whined about the stressful life that I had been living.  Yet I truly believe that I am going to miss this place.  Not because of the Academics or the constant harassing of Plebes(FRESHMAN), but I believe it will be the feeling that I belong to a group.  This group does not consist of simply Cadets or Ivy Leaguers.  It is not limited to the Northeast or New York.  This group is comprised of every college student in the world.  Think about it, we are a small group of special individuals. No matter where we go, there are always others to relate with.  The blue screen of death, wild spring breaks, knowing at least one person who has streaked, how can I forget the million and one drinking games, exams, exams, exams(ok, I think we got this point), and all the stupid pictures taken of us.  --NOT THAT I HAVE ANY OF THOSE FLOATING AROUND THE WEB--

this is your life, are you who you want to be
this is your life, is it everything you dreamed it would be
when the world was younger and you had everything to lose

So now what?  I have not landed my dream job nor have I thought about where I want to move to yet.  But who cares...sitting back and looking at my life, thanks to someone really close to me.  My life is GREAT!  Now I have not reached my mountain yet, but I really don't care right now.  BIG SMILES!!  Let me start my new story.  Ok here it goes...

DAY ONE: Hey world, I just woke up and wow I feel great.  I think I'll go for a run.  Yeah a run and you are not going to stop me.  HAH!  Go Meeeeeeeee!

"I'm gonna soak up the sun
Gonna tell everyone
To lighten up (I'm gonna tell 'em that)
I've got no one to blame
For every time I feel lame
I'm looking up o I'm gonna soak up the sun"

Lately Shania Twain has been the chosen music artist lately in many of your journal entries.  Well to not be left out, I shall use Shania as well.  I luv song # 7: IT ONLY HURTS WHEN I'M BREATHING

"And it only hurts when I'm breathing
My heart only breaks when it's beating
My dreams only die when I'm dreaming
So, I hold my breath -- to forget"

Most people look to this song as a sad song, which of course it may be considered.  Yet I look to this song as a source of strength.  I probably listen to it about 10 times a week.  The cause for this abnormal view of a song, especially its lyrics, is that my asthma causes me much pain.  Probably once a day I get a burning sensation in my lungs.  The air here at my school adversely reacts with my daily operations.  I hate this.  I want to go for a 12 mile run again and not hurt at all, but I have not been farther than a mile in about a year.  Have any of you pictured urself on top a the world or at least a high mountain overlooking everything below.  My mountain is covered with lush, green vegetation and the sun is shining.  There are a few clouds, because I like watching them hover overhead and make funny shapes.  --I LUV EARTH...BESTEST(JK) PLANET IN THE WHOLE UNIVERSE--  The sun is shining and there is a warm breeze.  I am usually alone, but more recently I picture myself with someone else.  I can never see her though, I just know that she is there.  From a self analysis, I believe that is my human desire telling me it is time to find someone special.  Who knows!?  Oh yes, there must a waterfall somewhere near by with crystal clear water, so I can see all the fish.  --NO MAN-EATING ONES, JUST BEAUTIFUL ONES WITH MANY C O L O R S--  What a dream....maybe someday I will be up there, FREE! 

~BACK TO REALITY NOW~

"I'm not surprised just how well I survived"

I placed this portion of the song here, because I am not surprised.  I have a lot to live for still and there is no way I am dying before I get to enjoy life more.  Plus, I have had so many friends and support that who would want to die.  So thank you for all of you who have been here this past semester, even though I have not known most of you for more than about a month or so.  This might sound strange, but how often do you really thank those around you for what they have done for you.  Even if the thing they did was minute in their eyes, but in ur eyes it made u smile for maybe just a moment.  Sometimes that is all we need though.  In my case, this place has sucked especially these last 3 years.  Many people complain that working out and working for peak performance is just a waste of time, but to me it is life.  Striving to excel both physically and academically is a necessity in my life, but the asthma has greatly limited my ability in both.  This is where you all come in, this means everyone who has responded to my entries.  Every day when I am able to put out my thoughts on this small plastic box called a computer and have all of u respond to it, it puts a smile on my face.  Complaining, smiling, laughing, joking, whatever you all may do, I luv it.  It shows that all of you are human. 

If any of you ever need any help, no matter what it is, come to me.  I will do my best to assist you in ur need.

Almost done for the year.  Only 3 more graded events, then my term ends may start.

I was feeling sick today.  This heat is slightly annoying.  I was not expecting this at all.  This past weekend I was wearing a sweater, but now I am forced to find my t-shirts.  At least we know that spring is truly here and summer not to far off.

Tomorrow I have 2 interviews.  One with Legg Mason's Senior Legal analysis and the other with a recruiting firm who believes that I am well suited for a job with Cardinal something... I just want a job right now and start my new life soon. 

How is everyone's life going.  Drop a line strangers.

Sorry, I have been away since Thursday.  So let me tell all of you my story.  

Thursday: I woke-up and pack in the dark at 5 in the morning.  Then drove down to Washington D.C.  I had this job convention called SACC(Service Academy Career Conference).  89 big name companies were there looking for only academy graduates.  That Thursday was only the initiation phase.  They simply reminded us of what we needed and how to present ourselves to the employers for interviews.  That night I went to bed and called it quits.  

Friday:  A new day and a great opportunity to shine. Arriving at the conference at 0830, I started immediately with making a scene.  Nothing big this time, just talking real loud and finding out as much information about each employer as I could.  Then I began my choosing of companies.  Beginning with the Secret Service, I received a cool pen and a message to finish my stupid resume that I have been working on for a month now.  Its freakin 33 pages long and requires in-depth analysis of my personal life, which I understand, but hate. Next came some stupid graduate school.  One that meant nothing to me so I can continue on with the companies.  I met with many DOD companies, such as Lockheed Martin, Sparta and many others.  None of them did I receive any second interviews with, which slightly confused me, but I can understand, since I was in a room full of individuals similar to myself.  There was a strange occurrence though.  The CIA, whom I have been applying with for a few months, came up to me and mentioned a position.  The strange thing was that the position was the identical position that I have been applying to for 2 months.  The agent mentioned that that would change.  Another agency was the State Department.  They appear to need someone with a civil engineering background, an international law background, and the ability to speak another language.  To their surprise(after I handed them my resume), I fit the profile perfectly.  So they mentioned that they would contact me within two weeks.  A job that I did land a second interview with, was Legg Mason.  Legg Mason is a Financial group who deals with large company finance.  They are huge in the private sector.  I was like WOW!!!  Well here's the job.  The employer needs someone with a law background to be a legal consultant for their company.  Not only did I fit the picture, but he liked how I was so interpersonal.  I was like YES YES YES!!!!!!!!  So I have an interview setup on Wednesday, but I first have to escape this place.  There were a few other companies, but they were of little interest to me.  Then came my drive back North in a thunderstorm.  I went home to Philly that night.  

Saturday: I woke-up and threw on another suit.  This time it was for a Holy Communion.  My 7 yr. old cousin received his sacrament.  I was so proud of him.  All the kids were in their little outfits and my cousins were so cute.  I wish I had some pictures to put on this page, b/c I know all of you would agree.  Well after that I went North.  That night was fun.  I shall leave that to everyone's imagination. 

Sunday: I came back to this freakin place.  West Point sucks.

I forgot to shave this morning.  Thankfully I have a baby face when it comes to shaving, so it is not that noticable.  "The Earth turns, the sun burns"  Currently I am trying to complete this operations order that is due for me by tonight.  Tomorrow I leave for DC to attend a career conference.  It is only for Academy graduates, to include RMC(Royal Military College of Canada).  This just might be my break!  I hope so, because I am feeling the strain of not acquiring a job that suits me.  "the hands grope, the ears hear, the pulse beats."
Man I need to find some ramps so I can change my darn oil in my car before I leave.  I hate putting unnecessary wear and tear on my vehicle if I do not need to.  If you take care of your vehicle, then it will take care of you. 
"I have long to discover something as true as this is;
       so with a 1000 sweet kisses;
 if your cold and lonely;
       with 1000 sweet kisses"

I need a vacation from my current life.  Oh, my services have been requested to be an adviser for a honor hearing, because of my legal background. "How the hell did I get here"  This means more time away from school and from my academics with graduation so close.  The darn thing starts this weekend and carries on into the week.  --IF YOU CANNOT TELL, I AM IN A SOLEMN MOOD.  ONE THAT DOES NOT ALLOW THE USUAL SMILE FOR I WISH ONLY TO BE FREE OF THIS PLACE-- 
My class starts soon and I have to prep my op. order and review the legal structure for this honor hearing. 

--OFF TO SAVE THE WORLD--

I always complain about my school, but what school can give you this type of power.  Some IT cadets were working on a protype program that does something with something.  Whatever, what intrigued me was when one of the cadets informed an instructor that the map given to them was incomplete.  Then the cadet requested a satelite photo to be taken of an entire county so that they could use a more accurate source for the program.  Satelite photograph??? Can your school request satellite photographs whenever they want it.  
Today I gave my presentation on a design for a parking garage.  My visuals were great.  I spent all week working on them and designing a garage from scratch, however, I failed to prep my actually presenting.  This became apparent when I gave it.  Man I lost my spot twice and used the word "basically" once.  There were two "ums" and gosh knows whatelse I did wrong.  
The good news for today is that I'm pretty much done, except for a portion of my coloquium presentation that I have to give tomorrow.  I do not care though.  All I want to do is sleep and graduate.  So soon!!!!!!

Well Well...another day is done and life is still sucking.  Whatever, I am almost done with this place.  Now the job thing is still up for grabs, however, I received 3 calls yesterday pertaining to possible offers in 3 government agencies.  The first one was the U.S. General Accounting Office in DC.  They find that my academic qualifications are more than perfect for a position they currently hold.  Not exactly certain what it is called, but I would study and analyze military operations within the U.S.  Then I would write up a report on the military's efficiency.  Sounds interesting and there are legal aspects to it as well.  With my knowledge of International law and UCMJ(Uniform Code of Military Justice), I would prove to be most valuable to them.  The second possible career path is with the EPA(Environmental Protection Agency).  There I would be trained as a special agent to conduct investigations into fraud cases by private companies and other governmental organizations.  With my knowledge of Business law and U.S. domestic law, I have the ability to determine the legality behind each company's operation.  --SPECIAL AGENT, SOUNDS LIKE SOMETHING FROM A MOVIE--  The last option is with the U.S. Marshalls Office.  Now this is really drawing my attention.  --WOW, WESLEY SNIPES HERE I COME--  Plain and simple, I would be a deputy marshall and track down fugitives in the U.S. and those who flee the country.  You can all see that my legal background fits right into both the domestic portion and the international portion.  Plus, I can go to Germany, Austria and Switzerland as well.  Since I have 6 years of German. 

--MAN I LUV GERMANY AND EUROPE FOR THAT MATTER.  IT'S SO BEAUTIFUL THERE, BUT I LUV AMERICA EVEN MORE SO DON'T THINK YOU CAN TALK ME OUT OF MY LUV FOR MY COUNTRY....HOOAH--

ok its back to work yet again.

What day is today?  Man Saturday.  Gosh where does all the time go.  Yesterday I was at a conference in NYC for business law.  The topic of conversation was directed at the Coalition and their efforts to bring democracy to Iraq.  The commander of the Jordanian military was there, an Israeli General, the Commandant for the Australian military Academy, a Colonel from Japan, a South Korean General(Maj. Gen. Moon), Mr. Uras from Turkish Mission to the UN, Rear Admiral Dymock from Britain, Mr. Castle who is the chief legal advisor to the Coalition Provisional Authority in Iraq, bunch of CEO's and a lot of journalist.  It was quite interesting to discuss foreign policy and international law with these individuals.  The best part of the whole deal was the free Starbucks coffee, free Krispy Kreme Donuts and Bagels, and the $100 lunch which of course was free.  -WOOHOO--
Last night I went out with some of my friends and ate dinner at this restraunt near West Point.  It was wonderful and I had a great time with my friends.  I had not enjoyed myself that much in so long.  Plenty of white wine and beer.  

Oh, the night prior to last night, I ate dinner with former Mayor Giuliani.  He showed up late, which was a wrong move on his part.  They had lots of free wine and man.  All of us cadets were so drunk and did they have to sit me with the assistant dean.  I definitely told him what I thought on certain courses.  --OOPS, PROBABLY NOT A SMART MOVE ON MY PART--  

I need a break though.  All week I have been babysitting this Uzbek cadet and I need a break from both him and school.  One positive thing from the conference besides the free food was one of the CEOs became interested in me.  He provided me with his contact information and it looks good for me.  I might be working for the United Arab Emirate corporation.  Lots of money to be made in this area and lots of travel as well.  However, most of the travel will be in the Middle East and I do not speak Arabic.  Well I better learn and soon.  

This is good enough for now.  I shall leave everyone to comment on my LJ, then go to another.

Yesterday I took my Uzbekistan cadet to the PX and ran into the Canadian team staying here for the Sandhurst Competition.  So the first question was who is from TO and only one said that she was, but the others did like the idea that I had some concept of what TO stood for.  They all spoke the weak language of french, but I will not hold that against them.  Once we go talking, it occurred to me that I brought not one, but 3 Uzbek cadets and so I had to go on a hunt to find the other 2.  Well while I was hunting for the other 2, the one that was with me decided to leave.  Luckily for me the Canadians were watching and told me that he left.  I hate not speaking Russian.  

Today is my cousins funeral and I am not able to make it back to PA to see it.  The Army does not feel that I have a legitimate reason for leaving my duty for one day.  --WHATEVER--  Its funny that all you do is train to fight and protect America, but sometimes America is all I want to attack.  --JUST THE GOVERNMENT AND YOUNG, PUNKY 16 YEAR OLDS, WHO CAN'T DRIVE WORTH SHIT.  IF I FIND HIM BEFORE HE IS INDICTED, I'M GOING TO KILL HIM AND HIS ENTIRE FAMILY...SHITHEAD--

Sorry for the anger, but I'm not a person to feel sadness, just anger.  I like it that way.  No weakness is shown then.  It's breakfast formation now.  Have a happy day everyone.

My three questions requested by buckeyealum:

1) If you could be one famous individual, who would that be from any time frame and do not worry about the sex?
ans: Napolean...I would luv to see his mass armies march over Europe.  Besides the military aspect, he brought liberal ideas to France and revived the arts and the need to preserve history.  Thanks to him, many of the current Egyptian artifacts that we have today were found by his armies.  Plus, he never quit, which was both good and bad for him.

2) If you could be any comic book hero or villian, who would you be and y?
ans: Of course Superman...man of steal, carried out good deeds, could fly, had unbelievable strength and one additional plus~X-ray vision :p!

3) If I gave you $1 million, what would you do with it?
ans: invest all of it after I bought myself an aston martin and put about $200,000 into a checking account for insurance purposes and to buy suits with.  Oh yeah, MONEY!!!
